text: Ali Bin Fahad Al-Shahwani Al-Hajri (born March 6, 1960), is a Qatari diplomat who served as the Qatar Ambassador to the United States, Canada and Mexico from 2008 to 2012. ==Life and career== Al-Hajri graduated from the University of Southern Colorado (now Colorado State University-Pueblo) in 1983 with a Bachelor of Arts degree in political science. He has served in diplomatic positions for much of his career, including Morocco from 1995 to 1997; the United Nations from 1997 to 2000; Italy, Greece, Albania, Macedonia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Croatia, Slovenia, and San Marino from 2000 to 2005. He was appointed Ambassador to the United States in 2008 and in 2009 was appointed non-resident ambassador to Mexico and Canada. ==External links== *Embassy of Qatar: Ambassador's bio via Qatar Embassy *Qatar: His Excellency Ali Fahad Falil Al-Shawany Al-Hajri via Washington Diplomat Category:1960 births Category:Living people Category:Ambassadors of Qatar to Canada Category:Ambassadors of Qatar to Mexico Category:Ambassadors of Qatar to the United States Category:Colorado State University–Pueblo alumni
title: Ali Bin Fahad Al-Hajri
